pr_title: HBASE-25329 Dump region hashes in logs for the regions that are stuck in transition for more than a configured amount of time

timeline.message: HBASE-25329 Dump region hashes in logs for the regions that are stuck in transition for more than a configured amount of time
HBASE-25329 Dump region hashes in logs for the regions that are stuck in transition for more than a configured amount of time

timeline.bodyText: 500 seems high to me. Would 20 be enough? Should this be a constant in the file, even if not configurable?
timeline.author: d-c-manning
d-c-manning

replies.bodyText:
Though I do think it's a good idea for limiting the logging. Should the LOG.debug statement be in here?

yes it is for the reason you stated. will add the comment and move LOG.debug under this condition. maybe the other stuff can be moved outside.
replies.author: caroliney14

timeline.bodyText: can we just reuse currentTime here from the beginning of the method?
timeline.author: d-c-manning

timeline.bodyText:
since this method uses the state.getStamp() to determine whether the RIT is over the threshold or the oldest time... should we just use getRegionsInTransitionOrderedByTimestamp instead?
This new method getRegionsInTransitionOrderedByDuration is tracking total duration instead of duration since last state transition, so the longest RITs may not necessarily be those that are reported over threshold. I think it's probably good to be consistent... I'm not sure which way is better to be consistent, but since these metrics in this method are reporting time since last change instead of total duration, I'd favor that approach.
timeline.author: d-c-manning

timeline.bodyText: should we also filter these to only those RITs that are over the threshold? Or do we want to display every RIT, even if it's only been transitioning for 100ms, if it's the longest/only RIT in the cluster?
timeline.author: d-c-manning

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense to only record RITs over threshold, since those would be the problematic ones
replies.author: caroliney14

timeline.bodyText:
Do we have to use name() as I see other references use state.getState() directly.
region names could be quite long - when you refer to hash, did you want the md5 encoded name?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      state.getRegion().getRegionNameAsString() + ":" + state.getState().name()
          
          
            
                      state.getRegion().getEncodedName() + ":" + state.getState()
          
      
    
    
  

Or should the entire region name be available?
timeline.author: d-c-manning

replies.bodyText: if the md5 encoded name is enough info for debugging (which I think yes), then it should suffice to use that 👍
replies.author: caroliney14

replies.bodyText: as for state, that is an enum, and we want the state name, which is why I added .name(). see this SO
replies.author: caroliney14

timeline.bodyText: we should only log if oldestRITHashesAndStates is non-empty.
timeline.author: d-c-manning
virajjasani
virajjasani

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to remove last appended new line char? If so, start index should be sb.length()-1 right?
timeline.author: virajjasani
virajjasani

timeline.bodyText: If you could convert this to entrySet(), that would be great (as per findbugs)
timeline.author: virajjasani
